speaker: CADE
text: Fie on ambitions! Fie on myself, that have a

speaker: CADE
text: sword and yet am ready to famish! These five days

speaker: CADE
text: have I hid me in these woods and durst not peep

speaker: CADE
text: out, for all the country is laid for me. But now am

speaker: CADE
text: I so hungry that, if I might have a lease of my life

speaker: CADE
text: for a thousand years, I could stay no longer.

speaker: CADE
text: Wherefore, o’er a brick wall have I climbed into

speaker: CADE
text: this garden, to see if I can eat grass, or pick a sallet

speaker: CADE
text: another while, which is not amiss to cool a man’s

speaker: CADE
text: stomach this hot weather. And I think this word

speaker: CADE
text: sallet was born to do me good; for many a time,

speaker: CADE
text: but for a sallet, my brainpan had been cleft with a

speaker: CADE
text: brown bill; and many a time, when I have been dry

speaker: CADE
text: and bravely marching, it hath served me instead of

speaker: CADE
text: a quart pot to drink in; and now the word sallet

speaker: CADE
text: must serve me to feed on.

speaker: IDEN
text:
Lord
              ,
               
              who
               
              would
               
              live
               
              turmoilèd
               
              in
               
              the
               
              court

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              may
               
              enjoy
               
              such
               
              quiet
               
              walks
               
              as
               
              these
              ?

speaker: IDEN
text:
This
               
              small
               
              inheritance
               
              my
               
              father
               
              left
               
              me

speaker: IDEN
text:
Contenteth
               
              me
              ,
               
              and
               
              worth
               
              a
               
              monarchy
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
I
               
              seek
               
              not
               
              to
               
              wax
               
              great
               
              by
               
              others’
               
              waning
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Or
               
              gather
               
              wealth
              ,
               
              I
               
              care
               
              not
               
              with
               
              what
               
              envy
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
Sufficeth
               
              that
               
              I
               
              have
               
              maintains
               
              my
               
              state

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              sends
               
              the
               
              poor
               
              well
               
              pleasèd
               
              from
               
              my
               
              gate
              .

speaker: CADE
text: Here’s the lord of the soil come to seize

speaker: CADE
text: me for a stray, for entering his fee-simple without

speaker: CADE
text: leave.—Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me and get a

speaker: CADE
text: thousand crowns of the King by carrying my head

speaker: CADE
text: to him; but I’ll make thee eat iron like an ostrich

speaker: CADE
text: and swallow my sword like a great pin, ere thou

speaker: CADE
text: and I part.

speaker: IDEN
text:
Why
              ,
               
              rude
               
              companion
              ,
               
              whatsoe’er
               
              thou
               
              be
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
I
               
              know
               
              thee
               
              not
              .
               
              Why
              ,
               
              then
              ,
               
              should
               
              I
               
              betray
               
              thee
              ?

speaker: IDEN
text:
Is
               
              ’t
               
              not
               
              enough
               
              to
               
              break
               
              into
               
              my
               
              garden

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
              ,
               
              like
               
              a
               
              thief
              ,
               
              to
               
              come
               
              to
               
              rob
               
              my
               
              grounds
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Climbing
               
              my
               
              walls
               
              in
               
              spite
               
              of
               
              me
               
              the
               
              owner
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
But
               
              thou
               
              wilt
               
              brave
               
              me
               
              with
               
              these
               
              saucy
               
              terms
              ?

speaker: CADE
text: Brave thee? Ay, by the best blood that ever was

speaker: CADE
text: broached, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I

speaker: CADE
text: have eat no meat these five days, yet come thou

speaker: CADE
text: and thy five men, and if I do not leave you all as

speaker: CADE
text: dead as a doornail, I pray God I may never eat

speaker: CADE
text: grass more.

speaker: IDEN
text:
Nay
              ,
               
              it
               
              shall
               
              ne’er
               
              be
               
              said
              ,
               
              while
               
              England
               
              stands
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
That
               
              Alexander
               
              Iden
              ,
               
              an
               
              esquire
               
              of
               
              Kent
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Took
               
              odds
               
              to
               
              combat
               
              a
               
              poor
               
              famished
               
              man
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
Oppose
               
              thy
               
              steadfast
               
              gazing
               
              eyes
               
              to
               
              mine
              ;

speaker: IDEN
text:
See
               
              if
               
              thou
               
              canst
               
              outface
               
              me
               
              with
               
              thy
               
              looks
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
Set
               
              limb
               
              to
               
              limb
              ,
               
              and
               
              thou
               
              art
               
              far
               
              the
               
              lesser
              ;

speaker: IDEN
text:
Thy
               
              hand
               
              is
               
              but
               
              a
               
              finger
               
              to
               
              my
               
              fist
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Thy
               
              leg
               
              a
               
              stick
               
              comparèd
               
              with
               
              this
               
              truncheon
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
My
               
              foot
               
              shall
               
              fight
               
              with
               
              all
               
              the
               
              strength
               
              thou
               
              hast
              ;

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              if
               
              mine
               
              arm
               
              be
               
              heavèd
               
              in
               
              the
               
              air
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Thy
               
              grave
               
              is
               
              digged
               
              already
               
              in
               
              the
               
              earth
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
As
               
              for
               
              words
              ,
               
              whose
               
              greatness
               
              answers
               
              words
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Let
               
              this
               
              my
               
              sword
               
              report
               
              what
               
              speech
               
              forbears
              .

speaker: CADE
text: By my valor, the most complete champion that

speaker: CADE
text: ever I heard! Steel, if thou turn the edge or cut not

speaker: CADE
text: out the burly-boned clown in chines of beef ere

speaker: CADE
text: thou sleep in thy sheath, I beseech God on my

speaker: CADE
text: knees thou mayst be turned to hobnails.

speaker: CADE
text: O, I am slain! Famine, and no other, hath slain me.

speaker: CADE
text: Let ten thousand devils come against me, and give

speaker: CADE
text: me but the ten meals I have lost, and I’d defy them

speaker: CADE
text: all. Wither, garden, and be henceforth a burying

speaker: CADE
text: place to all that do dwell in this house, because the

speaker: CADE
text: unconquered soul of Cade is fled.

speaker: IDEN
text:
Is
               
              ’t
               
              Cade
               
              that
               
              I
               
              have
               
              slain
              ,
               
              that
               
              monstrous
               
              traitor
              ?

speaker: IDEN
text:
Sword
              ,
               
              I
               
              will
               
              hallow
               
              thee
               
              for
               
              this
               
              thy
               
              deed
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              hang
               
              thee
               
              o’er
               
              my
               
              tomb
               
              when
               
              I
               
              am
               
              dead
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
Ne’er
               
              shall
               
              this
               
              blood
               
              be
               
              wipèd
               
              from
               
              thy
               
              point
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
But
               
              thou
               
              shalt
               
              wear
               
              it
               
              as
               
              a
               
              herald’s
               
              coat

speaker: IDEN
text:
To
               
              emblaze
               
              the
               
              honor
               
              that
               
              thy
               
              master
               
              got
              .

speaker: CADE
text: Iden, farewell, and be proud of thy victory. Tell

speaker: CADE
text: Kent from me she hath lost her best man, and

speaker: CADE
text: exhort all the world to be cowards; for I, that never

speaker: CADE
text: feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valor.

speaker: IDEN
text:
How
               
              much
               
              thou
               
              wrong’st
               
              me
              ,
               
              heaven
               
              be
               
              my
               
              judge
              !

speaker: IDEN
text:
Die
              ,
               
              damnèd
               
              wretch
              ,
               
              the
               
              curse
               
              of
               
              her
               
              that
               
              bare
               
              thee
              !

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              as
               
              I
               
              thrust
               
              thy
               
              body
               
              in
               
              with
               
              my
               
              sword
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
So
               
              wish
               
              I
              ,
               
              I
               
              might
               
              thrust
               
              thy
               
              soul
               
              to
               
              hell
              .

speaker: IDEN
text:
Hence
               
              will
               
              I
               
              drag
               
              thee
               
              headlong
               
              by
               
              the
               
              heels

speaker: IDEN
text:
Unto
               
              a
               
              dunghill
              ,
               
              which
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              thy
               
              grave
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
And
               
              there
               
              cut
               
              off
               
              thy
               
              most
               
              ungracious
               
              head
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Which
               
              I
               
              will
               
              bear
               
              in
               
              triumph
               
              to
               
              the
               
              King
              ,

speaker: IDEN
text:
Leaving
               
              thy
               
              trunk
               
              for
               
              crows
               
              to
               
              feed
               
              upon
              .
